content.prompt: What has the Supreme Court said about the right to privacy?

choices.label: A right to privacy is clearly present in the Constitution.
A right to privacy is listed in the 6th Amendment as a protected right.
A right to privacy has been the goal of many lawsuits but has never been recognized by the Supreme Court of the United States.
A right to privacy is not clearly present in the Constitution, but the court has determined that it does exist.
